newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber sees fresh buying for RSS3.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber sees fresh buying for RSS3.

text.p: Thai players engaged in a bout of fresh buying on Thursday for RSS3 grade rubber while more buyers were said to flock for SIR20 rubber as prices slid in Palembang in Indonesia, dealers said.

"There were some Thai buyers who purchased their April and May requirements and bought RSS3 at 121.25 (U.S.) cents (a kg) for April and 122.25 cents for May," a dealer for a rubber trading house said.
The slide in Palembang in Indonesia of SIR20 rubber prices also drew attention, the traders said. "We got some buyers when it fell to 50 (U.S.) cents a lb," one dealer said.

Another trader said some of the deals done were seen at "around 50-7/8 cents," he said. Malaysian exporters also sold about 400-500 tonnes of SMR20 rubber at about 287-288 Malaysian cents (a kg), traders said.

One dealer for a commodity house predicted prices may head lower in May/June after the end of wintering in the next few weeks. "I think we could see more pressure on prices then. We'll see more fun and games after wintering," he said.
At around 0945 GMT, May RSS3 was seen at 122.25 U.S. cents a kg from 122.00 cents.
